intro: Polybotrya aucuparia, commonly known as the golden star orchid, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the orchid family, Orchidaceae, and is characterized by its striking yellow flowers with a distinctive star-shaped pattern. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to trees in humid tropical environments. Its leaves are broad and革质 (leathery), which helps it retain moisture in its natural habitat. The orchid's unique floral structure attracts specific pollinators, contributing to its ecological significance in tropical ecosystems.
